Package io.smint.clapi.consumer.integration.core.authenticator

Interface IAuthTokenRefreshUtility

All Known Implementing Classes:
AuthTokenRefreshUtilityImpl
public interface IAuthTokenRefreshUtility
A utility to refresh the OAuth authentication token, in case it has expired.

Since refreshing a once valid OAuth authentication token can be performed without user interaction, such utility can be very simple. Implementing classes are NOT required to support complex first authorization, as this involves manual interaction. Utilities of that kind are only intended to refresh authentication tokens and not to obtain such token initially.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    IAuthTokenModel
    refreshOAuthToken(IAuthTokenModel expiredToken)
    Refresh expired authentication token data, utilizing the stored refresh token.

  • Method Details

    • refreshOAuthToken

      IAuthTokenModel refreshOAuthToken(IAuthTokenModel expiredToken) throws SmintIoAuthenticatorException
      Refresh expired authentication token data, utilizing the stored refresh token.

      The refresh is performed, no matter whether the authentication token has already expired or not. It is up to the caller to not call this method in case the authentication token is still valid. A refresh is attempted and a new token model is returned. The caller must check the return value to see, whether the new token is valid or not, thus whether refreshing the token has been successfully done or not.

      Return same data as passed-in in case of insufficient refresh data.

      In case the refreshing fails because of insufficient refresh token data, the originally passed-in token model data is returned unchanged if it has not yet expired. So token data that is valid before can be re-used. If the provided token data has already expired but its IAuthTokenModel.isSuccess() flag still returns true, then every data is copied to a new token model with its success flag being set to false. This will provide the opportunity to reuse still valid authentication data.

      Return some empty data if OAuth service rejected request.

      In case sufficient refresh data is available but the Smint.io OAuth service rejected the refresh request for some reason, a SmintIoAuthenticatorException exception is thrown.

      Parameters:
      expiredToken - the token to refresh - must not be null. If the token model does not contain sufficient data for refreshing the authentication token (like missing the refresh token), then refreshing fails. In such cases, a warnin is logged and the same token model is returned. So, if the passed-in token was valid, it is still, as it is returned unchanged in such cases.
      Returns:
      a token model instance and never null. If refreshing failed, then IAuthTokenModel.isSuccess() returns false. The reason for failure are just with a Level.WARNING
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - in case the parameter expiredToken is null.
      SmintIoAuthenticatorException - if refreshing was rejected by Smint.io's OAuth service.
